Detailed Description

template<class ELEMENT>
class IntrusiveObject< ELEMENT >

This is the base class for all intrusive objects.

An intrusive object is an object that automatically inserts itself into a collection when it is created and removes itself when it is destroyed.

Member Typedef Documentation

template<class ELEMENT>
typedef std::vector< ELEMENT * > IntrusiveObject< ELEMENT >::Container

This typedef specifies the container type that these intrusive objects will insert themselves into.

Reimplemented in IntrusiveStatWithRatesOfChange< TYPE >.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class ELEMENT>
IntrusiveObject< ELEMENT >::IntrusiveObject ( Container *&  pContainer,
bool  shouldAdd = true 
) [inline, protected]

The constructor takes reference to the a pointer that points to the container that the object will insert itself into.

If the container does not yet exist, it will be created.

template<class ELEMENT>
virtual IntrusiveObject< ELEMENT >::~IntrusiveObject (  )  [inline, protected, virtual]

The destructor automatically removes this object from the list it was inserted into.

If this leaves the collection empty, the collection is deleted.
